data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
All directions do not return to the same starting point. Take 9 steps left. 10 steps forward. 9 steps right. 10 steps backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around turns you back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go back you would have to take 6 steps to reach the starting point. To go around you would have to take 4 steps to reach the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You start at the beginning of the way you came. By taking 7 steps, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 5 steps again and take 10 steps for the same result. The answer: yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning right is a repeating action of turning right. So, the answer is yes.

Take 1 step back, take 2 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You would return to the starting point when you face forward. One way of doing this is to always face forward. To do this, you would first have to assume that you are facing left and start by facing forward with your index and middle fingers together. So, the answer is yes.

You can return to the starting point by turning around. You can take 2 steps and take 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you should move forward and take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is on the left. The starting point is always facing forward with the right foot first. The left foot first is taken back after 6 steps left. The right foot takes 1 step right after 6 steps backward. The left foot first takes 8 steps right after 1 step backward. The left foot first takes 2 steps left after 5 feet left step. So, the answer is Yes.

To return to the starting location with the correct path, you must keep facing forward. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, if you also have 3 steps forward and 5 steps backward, you will always return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Your forward motion should be a straight line and forward motion should be with your back or side to back. You can do either one or both of these directions and you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
